data.title: What's leaving SBS On Demand this month: April 2018
data.meta_description: We say goodbye to some great movies this month. Catch them at SBS On Demand while you still can.
data.text:
Click each image to play the film in full at SBS On Demand. Please note that the films on this list expire at various times throughout the month (If there is no 'play' button in the image, the film is no longer available).

The Deep Blue Sea

M

United Kingdom, 2011

Genre: Drama, Romance

Language: [language]

Director: Terence Davies

Starring: Rachel Weisz, Tom Hiddleston

What's it about?

Hester Collyer (Rachel Weisz) leads a privileged life in 1950s London as the beautiful wife of high court judge Sir William Collyer (Simon Russell Beale). To the shock of those around her, she walks out on her marriage to move in with young ex-RAF pilot, Freddie Page (Tom Hiddleston), with whom she has fallen passionately in love.

[link title="The Deep Blue Sea: Terence Davies interview" url="node/862"]

[link title="Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea: interview" url="node/1425"]

[link title="The Deep Blue Sea Review" url="node/5804"]

Source: SBS Movies

Orlando

PG

United Kingdom, 1992

Genre: Drama

Language: English

Director: Sally Potter

Starring: Billy Zane, Tilda Swinton

What's it about?

Tilda Swinton stars as Virginia Woolf's gender-bending hero, the noble Orlando who is commanded by Queen Elizabeth to stay forever young. Orlando experiences four centuries of sexual politics, initially through the eyes of a man, until one day Orlando wakes as a woman, struggling to retain her property and status.

[link title="Orlando review" url="node/58894"]

Source: SBS Movies

Blazing Saddles

M

USA, 1974

Genre: Comedy, Western

Language: English, German, Yiddish

Director: Mel Brooks

Starring: Gene Wilder, Harvey Korman

What's it about?

A town – where everyone seems to be named Johnson – is in the way of the railroad and, in order to grab their land, Hedley Lemar, a politically connected nasty person, sends in his henchmen to make the town unlivable. After the sheriff is killed, the town demands a new sheriff from the Governor, so Hedley convinces him to send the town the first black sheriff in the west.

[link title="Mel Brooks: 'Blazing Saddles' would never be made in today's 'stupidly politically correct' culture" url="node/157315"]

Source: SBS Movies

Shaft

MA15+

USA, 1971

Genre: Thriller, Crime, Adventure, Action

Language: English, Hungarian

Director: Gordon Parks

Starring:

What's it about?

Can you dig it? Cool black private eye John Shaft is hired by a crime lord to find and retrieve his kidnapped daughter.

Yolngu Boy

M

Australia, 2001

Genre: Drama

Language: [language]

Director: Stephen Johnson

Starring:

What's it about?

Three boys in Arnhem Land inhabit two cultures at once - that of North-East Arnhem Land and also western culture. Botj, Lorrpu and Milika are three Yolngu teenagers who once shared a dream of becoming great hunters. Now aged 14, only Lorrpu hasn\'t diverged. Botj is a lost soul in trouble with the law, and Milika is more interested in football and girls. One of the central themes of the film is the divide between the prosperity-driven, materialistic western ideal of life and the everyday reality faced by young Aborigines.

[link title="Yolngu Boy review: A truly impressive film" url="node/3720"]

[link title="This & That: 'Walkabout', 'Yolngu Boy'" url="node/157311"]

Source: SBS Movies

Full Metal Jacket

MA15+

USA, 1987

Genre: Drama, War

Language: English

Director: Stanley Kubrick

Starring: Matthew Modine, Vincent D'Onofrio, Adam Baldwin

What's it about?

An examination of the Vietnam War and the dehumanising process that turns people into trained killers. Joker, Animal Mother, Gomer, Eightball, Cowboy and more all are plunged into a boot-camp hell pitbulled by a leatherlung D.I. (Lee Ermey) who views the would-be devil dogs as grunts, maggots or something less.

[link title="Full Metal Jacket review" url="node/22145"]

Source: SBS Movies

Samson and Delilah

MA15+

Austraila, 2009

Genre: Drama

Language: [language]

Director: Warwick Thornton

Starring: Rowan McNamara, Marissa Gibson

What's it about?

Samson and Delilah's world is small- an isolated community in the Central Australian desert. When tragedy strikes they turn their backs on home and embark on a journey of survival. Lost, unwanted and alone the discover that life isn't always fair, but love never judges.

[link title="Samson And Delilah: a symbol of things to come" url="node/174"]

[link title="Samson and Delilah Review" url="node/4587"]

Excalibur

M

United Kingdom, USA, 1981

Genre: Fantasy, Adventure

Language: English

Director: John Boorman

Starring: Helen Mirren

What's it about?

The myth of King Arthur brought to the screen. Uthur Pendragon is given the mystical sword Excalibur by Merlyn. At his death Uthur buries the sword into a stone, and the next man that can pull it out will be King of England. Years later Arthur, Uthur's bastard son draws Excalibur and becomes king. Arthur's evil half-sister Morgana sires a son with him, who may prove his downfall.

Big Wednesday

PG

USA, 1978

Genre: Drama

Language: English

Director: John Milius

Starring: Gary Busey, Jan-Michael Vincent

What's it about?

Three 1960s California surfers fool around, drift apart and reunite years later to ride epic waves.

Mad Bastards

MA15+

Australia, 2011

Genre: Drama

Language: [language]

Director: Brendan Fletcher

Starring:

What's it about?

In the frontier town of Five Rivers, TJ the urban street warrior meets his match in Texas, a former Mad Bastard turned local cop. He also finds Bullet, his estranged son, and his personal transformation begins.

[link title="Mad Bastards Review" url="node/5318"]

Source: SBS Movies

Waiting for Guffman

M

USA, 1996

Genre: Comedy

Language: [language]

Director: Christopher Guest

Starring: David Cross, Parker Posey, Christopher Guest, Catherine O'Hara, Eugene Levy

What's it about?

Blaine, Missouri, may be small, but Corky St. Clair (Christopher Guest) always dreams big. Determined to get back to the lights of Broadway, he’s created Red, White and Blaine, a musical celebration of the burg’s 150th anniversary.

[link title="Waiting for Guffman Review" url="node/3625"]

[link title="This & That: 'Waiting For Guffman' & 'A Mighty Wind'" url="node/154413"]

Source: SBS Movies

A Mighty Wind

PG

USA, 2000

Genre: Drama, Comedy, Mock-umentary

Language: [language]

Director: Christopher Guest

Starring: Larry Miller, Fred Willard, Parker Posey, John Michael Higgins, Bob Balaban, Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, Harry Shearer, Ed Begley, Catherine O'Hara, Eugene Levy, Jennifer Coolidge

What's it about?

On the death of folk music manager Irving Steinbloom in 2003, his son Jonathan (Bob Balaban) orchestrates a memorial concert at New York’s Town Hall to reunite perfomers who Irving helped make almost famous in the 60s. The romantic duo Mitch & Mickey (Eugene Levy & Catherine O’Hara) are no longer on speaking terms but they agree; The Folksmen (Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, Harry Shearer) are no longer good looking youngsters, but they also agree; and so do the scattered members of the colour co-ordinated 'neuftet’ The New Main Street Singers (featuring John Michael Higgins, Jane Lynch and Parker Posey).

[link title="This & That: 'Waiting For Guffman' & 'A Mighty Wind'" url="node/154413"]

South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut

MA15+

USA, 1999

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Animation/3D

Language: English

Director: Trey Parker

Starring: Minnie Driver, Trey Parker, Matt Stone, George Clooney

What's it about?

After sneaking into an R-rated /Terrance and Phillip/ movie, the boys of South Park are announced as 'corrupted' and their parents pressure the United States to wage war with Canada.

Source: SBS Movies

The Pack

MA15+

France, 2009

Genre: Horror

Language: French

Director:

Starring: Yolande Moreau, Benjamin Biolay, Émilie Dequenne

What's it about?

Charlotte (Émilie Dequenne) is alone on a road trip. On an isolated side road, she picks up Max (Benjamin Biolay), a hitchhiker, who disappears in the bathroom of a truck-stop restaurant a few miles later. Puzzled, Charlotte comes back at night to look for him but gets caught by La Spack (Yolande Moreau), a singular woman in charge of an odd pack. Charlotte quickly realises she’s next on the menu.

[link title="The Pack Review" url="node/5390"]

Source: SBS Movies

Graffiti Bridge

PG-13

USA, 1990

Genre: Drama, Music

Language: English

Director: Prince

Starring: Prince

What's it about?

It's got that Purple Rain feeling through and though. And it's got The Kid, too! For the first time since Purple Rain, Prince is back as The Kid. And where he goes , there's music! With Thieves in the Temple, New Power Generation, Elephants and Flowers and more red-hot Prince tunes from the Platinum-selling Graffiti Bridge soundtrack. What time is it? Party time! Morris Day and the Time play Release It, Shake! and more. And you'll also see and hear George Clinton, Tevin Campbell, Robin Power, Mavis Staples and other hot performers, too. Graffiti Bridge is where the movie meets the music. Cross over on it now.

[link title="Learning to Love Prince’s 'Graffiti Bridge' and 'Under The Cherry Moon'" url="node/138955"]

Source: SBS

The Maid

M

Chile, 2009

Genre: Drama

Language: Spanish

Director:

Starring:

What's it about?

Fiercely loyal and compulsively hard-working, Raquel (Catalina Saavedra) has been serving the same family for more than 20 years. She is keenly observant and has sneakily implemented her own kind of order; deferential to the bumbling parents, affectionate to the two sons and increasingly resentful of the daughter who, it seems, can see through her game-plays. When her employer decides Raquel needs additional help after a series of dizzy spells, she rejects assistance and her vengeful (and frequently amusing) diversions with each incoming maid reach evermore audacious heights. Then someone different turns up and unexpectedly her contracting world within the house begins to ever-so-gently expand.

[link title="The Maid Review" url="node/4652"]

Source: SBS Movies

In the House

[classification]

France, 2012

Genre: [genre]

Language: [language]

Director: François Ozon

Starring: Kristin Scott Thomas, Fabrice Luchini, Emmanuelle Seigner

What's it about?

A 16-year-old teenager (Ernst Umhauer) sneaks into a classmate’s (Bastien Ughetto) house. He then writes about the event in stories for his French teacher (Fabrice Luchini). Inspired and confronted by the student, the teacher finds renewed joy in his job. Yet the teenager’s intrusion unleashes a series of uncontrollable events. Inspired by the Spanish play /The Boy in the Last Row/.

[link title="Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence in the House of God: Alex Gibney interview" url="node/1417"]

[link title="Mea Maxima Culpa: Silence in the House of God Review" url="node/6144"]

[link title="In the House Review" url="node/6242"]

Source: SBS Movies

Hairspray

PG

USA, 1988

Genre: Drama, Comedy, Romance, Family, Music

Language: English, French, Russian

Director: John Waters

Starring: Sonny Bono, Ruth Brown

What's it about?

Ample teen Tracy Turnblad wants nothing more than to be on the hip local TV dance program, "The Corny Collins Show" - and when her dream comes true, her lively moves and bubbly personality meet with unexpected popularity. But after witnessing firsthand the terrible state of race relations in 1960s Baltimore, Turnblad becomes an outspoken advocate for desegregation.

Source: SBS Movies
